skill.name: aeon
skill.description: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search. Use when working with temporal data, sequential patterns, or time-indexed observations requiring specialized algorithms beyond standard ML approaches. Particularly suited for univariate and multivariate time series analysis with scikit-learn compatible APIs.
skill.summary: Scikit-learn compatible Python toolkit for time series classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search.
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: All 516 static findings are false positives. Repository contains only markdown documentation files (SKILL.md and references/) with no executable code. Scanner incorrectly flagged markdown syntax (backticks for inline code), Python import examples, ML algorithm names (DTW, LCSS), and documentation URLs. No actual code execution, network calls, or credential access exists in this skill.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at SKILL.md:28
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Backtick character in markdown denotes inline code (uv pip install aeon). Not shell command execution. All 473 similar findings are false positives triggered by markdown backtick syntax.

All 21 similar findings are false positives triggered by ML algorithm names (DTW, LCSS, ERP) being misinterpreted as cryptographic references.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Python import statement in documentation code block (from aeon.anomaly_detection import STOMP). Documentation example, not runtime dynamic import. All 7 similar findings are false positives.
Line 88 contains 'Hybrid Classifiers' section header. Scanner incorrectly flagged 'reconnaissance' pattern match. All 7 similar findings are false positives triggered by benign ML terminology.
Legitimate documentation URL (https://www.aeon-toolkit.org/). No security concern for static documentation links.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [CRITICAL] obfuscation: DANGEROUS COMBINATION: Code execution + Network + Credential access at multiple:1
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: No actual code execution, network calls, or credential access in this documentation-only repository. Critical heuristic triggered by coincidental presence of documentation links and code examples. Zero runtime risk.

content.user_title: Apply time series ML with Aeon toolkit
content.value_statement: Time series data requires specialized algorithms beyond standard machine learning. Aeon provides scikit-learn compatible APIs for classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search on temporal data.
actual_capabilities: Classify time series into predefined categories using convolution-based, deep learning, and distance-based algorithms
Forecast future values with ARIMA, TCN, and deep learning forecasters
Detect anomalies and change points in temporal sequences
Cluster similar time series patterns without labels
Find motifs (repeated patterns) and discords (unusual subsequences)
Transform time series with feature extraction and preprocessing
limitations: Requires data in shape (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints) format
Deep learning methods require larger datasets for effective training
Some algorithms (HIVECOTEV2, InceptionTime) are computationally intensive

use_cases.title: Build predictive models
use_cases.description: Classify sensor readings, predict equipment failures, or forecast sales trends with specialized time series algorithms.

use_cases.title: Analyze temporal patterns
use_cases.description: Detect anomalies in physiological signals, segment genomic data, or find repeated motifs in experimental sequences.

use_cases.title: Scale time series pipelines
use_cases.description: Integrate with sklearn pipelines, compare benchmark results, and deploy production-ready time series models.

prompt_templates.title: Basic classification
prompt_templates.prompt: Use aeon to classify the time series data in X_train, y_train. Train a RocketClassifier and evaluate accuracy on X_test.

prompt_templates.title: Anomaly detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Detect anomalies in my time series y using aeon. Use the STOMP detector with window_size=50 and return indices where anomaly_scores exceed the 95th percentile.

prompt_templates.title: Forecasting
prompt_templates.prompt: Train an ARIMA forecaster (order=(1,1,1)) on my training data and predict the next 5 values.

prompt_templates.title: Pipeline optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an sklearn pipeline with Normalizer, RocketTransformer, and a GradientBoostingClassifier using aeon transformers and sklearn estimators.

output_examples.input: Classify my time series data using aeon

best_practices: Normalize time series data before applying most algorithms using aeon.transformations.collection.Normalizer
Start with MiniRocketClassifier or RocketClassifier for fast prototyping before trying deep learning methods
Validate model performance using cross-validation and compare against baseline methods like 1-NN Euclidean
anti_patterns: Using deep learning classifiers on small datasets with fewer than 100 samples
Skipping data normalization when working with DTW or other elastic distance measures
Ignoring the required input shape (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints)

faq.question: What is the input format for aeon?
faq.answer: Aeon expects time series in shape (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints). Univariate data should have n_channels=1.

faq.question: Which classifier is fastest?
faq.answer: MiniRocketClassifier offers the best speed-performance tradeoff. RocketClassifier is also fast with more kernels.

faq.question: Can I use sklearn pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, aeon transformers and classifiers are fully compatible with sklearn Pipeline and GridSearchCV.

faq.question: How to detect anomalies?
faq.answer: Use STOMP or LeftSTAMP from aeon.anomaly_detection. Fit and call fit_predict to get anomaly scores.

faq.question: What distances are available?
faq.answer: DTW, DDTW, WDTW, Euclidean, Manhattan, LCSS, ERP, EDR, TWE, MSM, and Shape-DTW.

faq.question: How to handle missing values?
faq.answer: Use SimpleImputer from aeon.transformations.collection before applying classifiers or forecasters.
